newsitem.title: USA: S.Dakota to sue tobacco industry - attorney general.
newsitem.headline: S.Dakota to sue tobacco industry - attorney general.

text.p: South Dakota will sue the nation's largest tobacco companies in a bid to recoup health care costs associated with treating smokers, the state's attorney general said Tuesday.

"We have stated we are going to file a lawsuit," South Dakota Attorney General Mark Barnett said in a telephone interview. "It will take a few weeks to put the suit together. I'd say 30 to 60 days to cycle up a lawsuit."

The disclosure came as settlement talks continued in Washington between lawyers for tobacco companies and negotiators for the dozens of states that have already sued the industry. To date, 37 states have sued.
Barnett said South Dakota would still participate in any settlement with the tobacco companies even if such a deal were reached before the state formally filed suit.

"All of the discussion that I've heard has been toward a global settlement -- in other words, all 50 states. That would be true whether they filed or not," Barnett said. "I've spoken with a key member of the Senate, and he has assured me that no deal would go through without including South Dakota."
